Punjab seeks to promote drip irrigation.description: BATHINDA: With water-guzzling paddy transplantation already begun, the Punjab government is thinking up ways to take control of the fast depleting underground water table. One such measures at sustainable water management is its latest attempt at promoting drip irrigation in maize crop. The state agriculture and farmer welfare department has fixed a target for sowing maize: 1.50 lakh hectare. A pilot project of micro irrigation on maize crop will be taken up in 1,000 acre this season under state government’s ambitious project Tandrust Punjab. Maize sowing had been on decline in Punjab over the years. The reason why the state government has fixed a target to increase acreage under maize in Punjab. In 2012-13 and 2013-14, the maize was sown in 1.31 lakh hectare, in 2014-15 it was 1.26 lakh hectare, in 2015-16 1.27 lakh, in 2016-17 1.16 lakh and in 2017-18 the maize was sown in 1.14 lakh hectare with production of 4.10 lakh metric tonne. This season’s production target stands at 5.70 lakh tonne. Mission director of Tandrust Punjab, KS Pannu, who is also secretary Punjab agriculture, said, “Out of 1,000 acre of maize under drip irrigation, 900 acre will be on surface drip system and 100 acre will be sub-surface drip system. Four micro irrigation companies will demonstrate drip irrigation on an area of 10 acre each to show farmers how water can be conserved through drip irrigation and also to prevail them upon to adopt the drip irrigation system.” Pannu said that department officials have been directed to promote alternative methods of crop watering in the wake of serious water resource challenge the state is likely to face in the coming years. According to soil conservation officials, drip irrigation not only conserves water but it also increases yield. Experts from Punjab Agricultural University said that they have successfully conducted experiments of sub-surface drip irrigation system on maize, wheat and moong and that it should be promoted on mass scale. It is to be mentioned here that a pilot campaign of micro irrigation on cotton was also undertaken this season by soil conservation department, under which 200 acre of cotton crop has been brought under drip irrigation. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. 4-year-old Kathua boy falls into 20ft we.description: PATHANKOT: The district administration fell into a panic after report of a four-year-old boy falling into a borewell in Pathankot was flashed in a section of media on Friday morning. However, deputy commissioner Pathankot, Ramvir denied the report saying the boy named Pardeep was not from Pathankot, but from the neighbouring Kathua district of Jammu and Kashmir. The boy had fallen in a small pit while playing and broke his leg and was later shifted to Pathankot for medical treatment. Pardeep lives with his uncle Bittu Kumar, a resident of Kirian Gandial village in Kathua district. “We have confirmed that the boy belongs to Kathua district whose leg was fractured after falling in a pit while playing. He was admitted to a private hospital in Pathankot and is under treatment. We are taking care of him,” said Ramvir, adding that Pathankot administration had already got all the borewells sealed. He said the boy was recovering and would be discharged from hospital by evening. Earlier, there were reports that a Pathankot boy had fallen in a borewell but was immediately rescued by his family members. Kidian and Gandyal villages are spread across Pathankot and Kathua districts of Punjab and Jammu and Kashmir. Notably, a two years old boy, Fatehveer Singh, resident of Bhagwanpur village in Sangrur, had fallen into a 150-feet-deep and seven inches wide borewell on June 6 and was brought out dead after 110 hours on June 11. Following the incident, Punjab government had directed all the deputy commissioners of state to ensure that no borewell was left open. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP MLA wants Narendra Modi government t.description: AMRITSAR: A Sikh BJP MLA from Delhi, Manjinder Singh Sirsa, has asked the Narendra Modi-led BJP government at the Centre to tender an apology for Operation Bluestar, an army action carried out to flush out armed militants from the Golden Temple in 1984. Sirsa, who is the legislator from Rajouri Garden, said in a press release issued here on Monday: "It is most unfortunate to see that even 35 years after the attack on the most sacred place of humanity by the Indian government, successive governments at the Centre failed to apologize to the Sikh community for causing them wounds which have never healed." Sirsa, who is president of Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee (DSGMC), said there were demands for apologies for Komagata Maru and Jallianwala Bagh tragedies, but "Sikhs and peace-loving people feel that the Indian government owes an apology for hurting feelings of all human beings" through a "well planned" conspiracy. Sirsa claimed that recent reports emerging from the UK suggested that the then Prime Minister, Indira Gandhi, was planning an attack on the Golden Temple much before it happened and had sought help of the then UK Prime Minister, Margret Thatcher, who deputed a member of the UK's Special Air Services to India to help in planning the controversial operation. "These reports have made it clear that the motive was to target the minorities, especially the Sikhs, as she wanted to win over the confidence of the country's majority to get political mileage," said Sirsa. He also demanded an inquiry commission of a sitting judge of the Supreme Court to understand what circumstances were created to execute Operation Bluestar. Bathinda ASI suspended for beating youth.description: BATHINDA: An assistant sub-inspector (ASI) of Bathinda police has been suspended after being accused of beating up a youth mercilessly. Manvir Singh (24) of Nawa Killa village in Faridkot district was allegedly following a woman from Mehma Sawai village in Bathinda when he was rounded by ASI Kaur Singh. The in-laws of the woman had complained against the youth. The cop allegedly thrashed the youth on Sunday. Manvir's kin Angrej Singh said, initially, they took Manvir to a private hospital in Bathinda, but was referred to Guru Gobind Singh Medical College, Faridkot. Bathinda SSP Nanak Singh said Kaur Singh had been placed under suspension. "A police team has been sent to Faridkot to record the statement of the boy," he addded. Woman dragged, punched, kicked; Congress.description: BATHINDA: Police on Friday booked a Congress councillor of Muktsar municipal council, arrested his brother and five of his associates after a video went viral in which a group of well-built men are seen dragging a woman out of her house and brutally assaulting her with punches, kicks and a leather belt. Muktsar SSP Manjit Singh Dhesi said they were on the lookout for the concillor and he had been charged with criminal conspiracy, though he was not present on the spot when the incident took place. In the video, the men do not soften the assault even when the woman’s five-year-old son is heard crying. Near the end of the video, the men are also seen brutally assaulting the woman’s elderly mother when she comes to save her. SSP Dhesi said Meena Rani, the woman was assaulted, had informed them that she owed Rs 23,000 to Congress councillor Rakesh Chaudhary's brother, Suresh Chaudhary. As she could not pay the money on time, the accused got her beaten up. Rani has been admitted to Muktsar civil hospital and is stated to be out of danger, though brusied and with abrasions. Though TOI spoke to Meena’s mother, it could not ascertain her name. The woman told TOI that Suresh Chaudhary demanded Rs 23,000 from them on Friday, but they did not have any money and sought five days to repay it and even promised to pay him interest. “But he did not listen to us and threatened us with dire consequences if the money was not returned immediately. About 11am, he came along some accomplices and barged into our home. He dragged my daughter out of the house and started beating her up. They also abused her and did not spare me when I went to save her,” she said. She said their entire family was of labourers. “We would not have taken the loan from them if we would have known they were so ruthless,” she said. SSP Dhesi said Suresh Chaudhary and his accomplices Roop Lal, Sunny Chaudhary, Guddi, Sekhu and Jebo had been charged with sections 307 (attempt to murder), 452 (house trespass), 354(assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty), 354B (assault or use of criminal force to woman with intent to disrobe) and 120B (criminal conspiracy) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC). “Efforts are being made to arrest others involved in the incident, including the councillor,” he said. Chaudhary was with Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) at first. He contested the last MC polls as an independent and won. He later on joined the Congress. BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .
